poem:
"Lord Ranger's Fall"

Harvest of ambition, flecked with the must of hubris,
Unraveled in night's excess, on the world's crude loom.
A year in ale's wilderness, scorn of scorned lips —
No solace in the hallowed, haunted rooms. 
Three weeks of exile: self's bitter fellowship.
By wavering light, sin's shadow looms,
Rich in sorrow, poor in triumph,
Etched in print, his hushed reproof.
From power's steep precipice, the giddy plunge.
